citation.article-title: Alkanindiges illinoisensis gen. nov., sp. nov., an obligately hydrocarbonoclastic, aerobic squalane-degrading bacterium isolated from oilfield soils.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Alkanindiges (Al.kan.in.diâ€²ges. N.L. neut. n. alkanum alkane; L. adj. indiges in need; N.L. masc. n. Alkanindiges the alkane-requiring one, indicating the bacterium's growth requirement for such hydrocarbons).
Gram-variable, probably due to extensive extracellular coat (see species description below).
In both liquid and solid media, growth is very poor in the absence of linear alkane hydrocarbons with chain-length below C16.
The type and only species described to date is Alkanindiges illinoisensis, although an as-yet-uncultured bacterium, JN3c, may be congeneric.
